SEARCH
Package utility

Class CSVread

java.lang.Object
utility.CSVread
public class CSVread extends Object
The class provides utility methods for reading various types of CSV files and mapping the data into different object types, such as User, Patient, Doctor, Pharmacist, Administrator, InventoryItem, ReplenishRequest, MedicalRecord, Schedule, and Appointment.

It dynamically maps CSV columns to object fields using a column mapping provided by the caller, making it highly flexible for different CSV structures.

  • Constructor Details

    • CSVread

      public CSVread()

  • Method Details

    • readCSV

      public static List<Object> readCSV(String fileString, Map<String,Integer> columnMapping, String objectType)
      Reads a CSV file and maps each row to a corresponding object based on the provided objectType. The method supports reading data for different object types, such as User, Patient, Doctor, Pharmacist, and Administrator.
      Parameters:
      fileString - The path to the CSV file to be read.
      columnMapping - A map that associates CSV column names with their index positions.
      objectType - The type of object to create for each row ("User", "Patient", "Doctor", etc.).
      Returns:
      A list of objects created from the CSV data, based on the objectType.

    • readItemCSV

      public static List<InventoryItem> readItemCSV(String fileString, Map<String,Integer> columnMapping)
      Reads an inventory CSV file and maps the rows to a list of InventoryItem objects. This method expects columns for medicine name, initial stock, and low stock level.
      Parameters:
      fileString - The path to the CSV file.
      columnMapping - A map that associates column names with their index positions in the CSV.
      Returns:
      A list of InventoryItem objects created from the CSV data.

    • readReplenishCSV

      public static List<ReplenishRequest> readReplenishCSV(String fileString, Map<String,Integer> columnMapping)
      Reads a replenish request CSV file and maps the rows to a list of ReplenishRequest objects. It parses fields like request ID, medicine name, quantity, requested by, request date, and status.
      Parameters:
      fileString - The path to the replenish request CSV file.
      columnMapping - A map that associates column names with their index positions in the CSV.
      Returns:
      A list of ReplenishRequest objects created from the CSV data.

    • readMedicalRecordCSV

      public static List<MedicalRecord> readMedicalRecordCSV(String fileString, Map<String,Integer> columnMapping)
      Reads a CSV file containing medical record information and parses it into a list of MedicalRecord objects. The method uses a column mapping to identify which columns to read for each field.
      Parameters:
      fileString - The path to the CSV file to read.
      columnMapping - A map that associates column names to their respective indices in the CSV file.
      Returns:
      A list of MedicalRecord objects containing the parsed data.

    • readScheduleCSV

      public static List<Schedule> readScheduleCSV(String fileString, Map<String,Integer> columnMapping)
      Reads a CSV file containing schedule information and parses it into a list of Schedule objects. The method uses a column mapping to identify which columns to read for each field.
      Parameters:
      fileString - The path to the CSV file to read.
      columnMapping - A map that associates column names to their respective indices in the CSV file.
      Returns:
      A list of Schedule objects containing the parsed data.

    • readApptCSV

      public static List<Appointment> readApptCSV(String fileString, Map<String,Integer> columnMapping)
      Reads a CSV file containing appointment information and parses it into a list of Appointment objects. The method uses a column mapping to identify which columns to read for each field. It then reconstructs the Doctor and Patient objects using their respective IDs.
      Parameters:
      fileString - The path to the CSV file to read.
      columnMapping - A map that associates column names to their respective indices in the CSV file.
      Returns:
      A list of Appointment objects containing the parsed data.
